item.title: ChainLadder Package in Action
item.description: Actuarial Central Estimate — An estimate that represents an expected value over the range of reasonably possible outcomes – Actuarial Standards of Practice No. 43 Introduction The definition of an “actuarial central estimate” is extermely vague; it doesn’t actually mean anything. A better estimation uses an algorithm to derive the estimation. As a simple example of a good estimator of central tendancy we can look at the sample mean:
